intro: Pilosella prasinata, commonly known as the green tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green ray florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pilosella prasinata typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
